intro: Spergularia degenii, commonly known as the coastal sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to coastal areas of the United States and southern Europe. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its small, pink or white flowers and succulent-like leaves. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dune environments. It has a prostrate growth habit and produces capsules that contain numerous tiny seeds. Spergularia degenii is adapted to harsh coastal conditions, including salt spray and strong winds.
